definition: A bestie means a person's best friend and can be used ironically online.
mw_examples: The holiday was a present from my {wi}bestie{/wi} to celebrate my 32nd birthday …

definition: To deplatform means to prevent (a person holding views regarded as unacceptable or offensive) from contributing to a forum or debate, especially by blocking them on a particular website.
mw_definition: to remove and ban (a registered user) from a mass communication medium (such as a social networking or blogging website); broadly : to prevent from having or providing a platform to communicate
mw_examples: … had almost 1.5 million Facebook followers and a quarter million followers on Instagram before he was {wi}deplatformed{/wi} for repeatedly spreading misinformation …

definition: A webseries is a series of scripted or non-scripted online videos, generally in episodic form, released on the Internet.
Lollys is short for lolipops.
mw_definition: a piece of candy; especially : hard candy

definition: Brainrot is slang for a strong fixation on a particular topic, often a person, hobby, or piece of media.
Lewdity is dressing in a way that does not actually reveal anything but at a distance gives the impression that it might.
Terpy is slang for terpenes and describes someone who smokes thc often.
OMDS is slang for oh my days.
Slurs are words expressing a negative or a disrespectful connotation, a low opinion, or a lack of respect toward someone or something.
mw_definition: an insulting or disparaging remark or innuendo : aspersion
mw_etymology: obsolete English dialect {it}slur{/it} thin mud, from Middle English {it}sloor{/it}; akin to Middle High German {it}slier{/it} mud

definition: Frownies are patches that target the facial muscles to smooth and lift static wrinkles and expression lines.
E-dating is the Internet equivalent of a date; the process of getting to know someone, with a view to romance, via instant messages or other computerized communication.
Transmigrates mean for the soul to pass into a different body after death.
mw_definition: to cause to go from one state of existence or place to another
mw_etymology: Latin {it}transmigratus{/it}, past participle of {it}transmigrare{/it} to migrate to another place, from {it}trans-{/it} + {it}migrare{/it} to migrate

definition: A dosser is a homeless person.
mw_definition: someone with no established residence : an unhoused person
mw_examples: An increasing number of young {wi}dossers{/wi} are also using trains parked for the night near Victoria station.
The young Scottish painter Peter Howson transforms Glasgow {wi}dossers{/wi} (street people) into heroic figures.
mw_etymology: earlier, "person frequenting a cheap rooming house," from {et_link|doss:1|doss:1} + {et_link|-er:2|-er:2}

definition: A freshie is short for freshman.
Derangements are mental disorders or serious mental disturbances.
mw_definition: to disturb the operation or functions of
mw_examples: {it}deranged{/it} by even the slightest damage
hatless, with tie {it}deranged{/it}
mw_etymology: French {it}déranger{/it}, from Old French {it}desrengier{/it}, from {it}des-{/it} de- + {it}reng{/it} line, row {ma}{mat|rank:1|}{/ma}

definition: Puffers are warm waist-length or hip-length coats filled with thick soft material sewn into sections, especially one in which the sections look as though they are puffed up.
mw_definition: any of a family (Tetraodontidae) of chiefly tropical scaleless marine bony fishes which can distend themselves to a globular form and most of which are highly poisonous : puffer fish
mw_examples: Yet this flood of fashion has a downside. … Can you layer a {wi}puffer{/wi} over a suit without looking, well, portly?
Surrounded by two-pack-a-day cigarette {wi}puffers{/wi}, he was a cigar smoker.
When it's wet or humid, lubricate sticky locks with a graphite {wi}puffer{/wi} or talcum.

definition: A sortation is the process of sorting or its result.
Bucked is used in an idiom that describes the process of becoming encouraged, reinvigorated, or cheerful.
mw_definition: to spring into the air with the back arched
mw_examples: {wi}bucking{/wi} for a promotion

definition: Bookish means devoted to reading and studying rather than worldly interests.
To swill means to drink (something) greedily or in large quantities.
mw_examples: {wi}swill{/wi} beer

definition: v-tubers are online entertainers who use a virtual avatar generated using computer graphics.
An allowlist is a directory of specific elements that are allowed, e.g. email addresses, IP addresses or URLs etc.
Being hyperlexic is having advanced and unexpected reading skills and abilities in children way beyond their chronological age.
Slayyyy is a slang term used to express excitement and approval over someone else's action or appearance.
A bebecita is a Spanish word that is similar to calling a girl babe, babygirl, baddie, or hottie.
WTV means whatever.
WIBTA stands for "Would I be the asshole".
Uninviting means not pleasant or appealing.
mw_definition: not appealing or attractive : not inviting
mw_examples: a bleak, {wi}uninviting{/wi} landscape
an {wi}uninviting{/wi} manner

definition: Blud is slang that is used to address men and means bro.
A tradwife in recent Western culture, typically denotes a woman who believes in and practices traditional sex roles and marriages.
A grifter is a person who engages in petty or small-scale swindling.
mw_definition: to obtain (money or property) illicitly (as in a confidence game)

definition: Problematic is used online as slang to describe someone who's said or done things that might be considered sexist, racist, or otherwise offensive to a group of individuals.
mw_definition: posing a problem : difficult to solve or decide
mw_examples: a {wi}problematic{/wi} situation
Their future remains {wi}problematic{/wi}.
It is {wi}problematic{/wi} whether … terrorist attacks and conflicts … will generate the national coherence that twentieth-century wars did.
The page is monitored for {d_link|trolling|troll:2} and members can report any {wi}problematic{/wi} posts.
"We are bombarded with so much {wi}problematic{/wi} content, from misinformation to hate speech," [Maria D. Molina] said.
[Philip] Nel said the decision to no longer publish titles that include racist caricatures showed just one way to address {wi}problematic{/wi} material.
a {wi}problematic{/wi} proposition

definition: A pretext is an excuse to do something or say something that is not accurate.
mw_definition: a purpose or motive alleged or an appearance assumed in order to cloak the real intention or state of affairs
mw_etymology: Latin {it}praetextus{/it}, from {it}praetexere{/it} to assign as a pretext, screen, extend in front, from {it}prae-{/it} + {it}texere{/it} to weave {ma}{mat|technical|}{/ma}

definition: Self-sabotage is when people do (or don't do) things that block their success or prevent them from accomplishing their goals.
Maidenless is online slang to refer to someone who has never been in a relationship and is single.
